results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films

results.title: Goldwood
results.creator_credit: Kathleen Shannon, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Goldwood is a search for the early self, in this case the period is associated with life at a previously abandoned gold mine in the northern Ontario wilderness in 1941-42. A woman describes the look and feel of her childhood to an artist friend. The story of her days at Goldwood unfolds through his paintings and live footage of their visit to the site. Nature has reclaimed the land. The adult attempts to reclaim the child. The woman discovers pieces of her doll’s plate lost thirty years earlier. The film evokes the universal feelings of a child in an adult’s world and the awareness of self. Paintings and photography by Blake James.

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the goldmine
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Using a combination of live actors and a puppet - “Sebastian the Fox” - this film tells how two unscrupulous miners sell a supposedly worthless mine to Sebastian for 5 Pounds. Sebastian promptly unearths a nugget; the miners try to steal it. Sebastian, however, “outfoxes” them and the rascally pair are left with an old boot as the fox drives off with the nugget. No dialogue spoken. Credits include: writing by Tim Burstall; photography by Giorgio Mangiamele; editing by Alan Harkness and Michael Thornhill; music by George Dreyfus.

results.title: The Golden West USA
results.brief_description: A tour of the western states of America, taking in San Francisco, Virginia City, left to die after the gold rushes, Salt Lake City, home of the Mormons, the surrounding “dinosaur country”, the splendour of a Grand Canyon sunset, the vast deserts of New Mexico, exciting Los Angeles with its Disneyland and Hollywood studios, and finally a trip up the majestic Pacific coast.

results.title: Golden Transvaal
results.creator_credit: John Da Silva and South African Tourist Corporation
results.brief_description: Within the borders of the Transvaal is to be found a wide diversity of attractions, both natural and manmade. These include Johannesburg, historic Pretoria, the flat plains and mountain ranges and the warm sub-tropical Lowveld, and the Kruger National Park.

results.title: Golden river
results.creator_credit: P.V. Pathy and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Rising in the ranges of Coorg, the Kaveri River flows eastwards for nearly 500 miles before entering the Bay of Bengal, traversing ancient agricultural lands, rich in rice and coffee. Traces the course of the Kaveri River which has been considered sacred by the Hindus for centuries. The waters of the river have been utilised for the generation of electic power at Sivasamudram and harnessed in Mysore and Mettur for the two great dams which irrigate thousands of acres of land.

results.title: The Golden ring
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Burton, BBC-TV and Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen
results.brief_description: An impression of the enormous musical and technical resources which went into the recording of “Gotterdammerung”, the latest chapter in an ambitious project to record Wagner’s entire Ring Cycle. With actual takes of the Immolation scene, Siegfried’s Funeral March and the ‘Vengeance’ trio which ends Act II, and behind the scenes film of rehearsals, playbacks, recordings, and interviews with some of the principal artists. Singers include Birgit Nilsson, Wolfgang Windgasson, Gottlob Frick, Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau, Clare Watson. Conductor - Georg Solti.

results.title: Golden queen
results.creator_credit: Zain Hussain and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: The pineapple industry in Malaya; harvesting, canning and selling the crop; the organisation of the industry; clearing land for new plantations, planting and caring for the plants; life on the plantation village.

results.title: Golden Bay
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Stanhope Andrews and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A social study of the occupations, leisure activities, community life and local government of the people of Takaka (South Island, New Zealand) and its surrounding district, Golden Bay. Farming is the main business of the people but the area is linked historically with Abel Tasman’s discovery of New Zealand.
